member.name: T:CMS.Routing.Web.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute
member.summary: Represents a route to a Kentico HTTP handler using a route template that supports inline constraints.
member.remarks:
Route templates are compatible with ASP.NET MVC 5 route templates with the following exceptions:
Only guid and int inline constraints are supported, other constraints are ignored.
There must be no unpaired braces except the escaped ones, otherwise an exception is thrown.
Routes to Kentico HTTP handlers are excluded from URL generation, i.e. in MVC applications it is not possible to accidentally generate an URL to a Kentico HTTP handler instead of a controller action.

member.name: P:CMS.Routing.Web.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute.MarkedType
member.summary: Gets the type of a Kentico HTTP handler.

member.name: P:CMS.Routing.Web.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute.RouteTemplate
member.summary: Gets the route template.

member.name: P:CMS.Routing.Web.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute.Order
member.summary: Gets or sets the order weight of the route.
member.remarks: Routes are sorted for each HTTP handler in increasing order based on the order value. Routes without the order weight specified have an order value of 0. Negative values are valid and can be used to position a route before all non-negative routes.

member.name: M:CMS.Routing.Web.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The type of a Kentico HTTP handler.

member.name: M:CMS.Routing.Web.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute.PreInit
member.summary: Adds this instance to the table with routes to Kentico HTTP handlers.

member.name: M:CMS.Routing.Web.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute.GetHttpHandler(System.Web.Routing.RequestContext)
member.summary: Provides the Kentico HTTP handler that processes the request.
member.param: An object that encapsulates information about the request.
member.returns: A Kentico HTTP handler that processes the request.

member.summary: Returns domain alias redirection URL.
member.param: Domain alias which matches domain of the current request.
The current domain, including "www." prefix if present
member.returns: Redirection URL when specified and redirect is necessary, null otherwise.
member.exception: Only absolute URL is supported for the redirection URL of a site domain alias.

member.name: M:CMS.Routing.Web.AdvancedGetFileHandler.FixSessionIdForInProcOptimization(System.Web.HttpContextBase)
member.summary:
is implementation of . This may cause that session created within request handled by this handler won't be saved due to optimization in default . The optimization is trying to postpone creation of session to the latest request event (.
used for data transmition is eagerly flushing response to the client. The first flush is sending response headers (in our case without sessionId). In case of not existing session id in cookies the postponed sessionId creation causes an exception (not affecting current response or CMS system, the exception is logged to the system log).
The optimization is used only if following conditions are satisfied: is is Cookies are used as sessionId storage.
